title: What are the pre-colonial period developments in science and technology in the Philippines? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’d say that the most prominent technology that the natives had were the (Lantakas), these are pre-colonial cannons. They designed them and manufactured them… and this also means that they were knowledgeable about how to make gunpowder. The pre-colonial natives were also great goldsmiths, and while these are more ornamental, they’re never the less impressive. Just try to imagine how they made these deigns with the technology that they had at that time (10th to 13th century), especially the (kamagi) or “gear-links”.      Here’s a video discussing and explaining these artifacts.
